entry.title: desk_profiles: Clean up desk profile setting from DeskProfilesButton
entry.content:
The button was previously modifying the lacros profile ID on the desk it

was associated with *if* the desk had the lacros profile ID 0. It also

meant that a newly created desk would have ID 0 until the user brings up

the desk bar.



It was always quite weird to have the button be responsible for updating

the profile ID of the desk. The zero ID was also intended to be an alias

for the primary user.



This CL removes the code from the button and makes sure that the desk

profiles delegate properly treats ID 0 as an alias for the primary user.



BUG=b:323233683



Change-Id: I38447bca445d227bbd1b244565b42fab9e5d5284

entry.title: Reland "autotest.py: Support policy to pref mappings tests"
entry.content:
This relands commit e7481c50566157a6f84fd7c3fc8a9cc7bf694d89.

Which was reverted in commit dc8e02663bd4f9dc83f88b71d01b98f1f72e653a.



There was an issue in the original CL where the argument

--test_policy_to_pref_mappings_filter gets popuplated when there are no

policy pref mapping test files. This wasn't noticed because c++ unit

tests and browser tests ignore this flag and work correctly. Android

tests OTOH throw an error because the flag is unknown.



This CL filters policy pref mapping files when building the flag.



Original change's description:

> autotest.py: Support policy to pref mappings tests

>

> Pref mapping test files now work, for example:

> $ tools/autotest.py -C out/Default \

> components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping/NewWindowsInKioskAllowed.json

> $ tools/autotest.py -C out/Default \

> components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping \

> --test_policy_to_pref_mappings_filter=NewWindowsInKioskAllowed

>

> Which are equivalent to:

> $ autoninja -C out/Default browser_tests

> $ out/Default/browser_tests \

> --gtest_filter="*PolicyPrefsTest.PolicyToPrefsMapping" \

> --test_policy_to_pref_mappings_filter="NewWindowsInKioskAllowed"

>

> Bug: b:319254568

> Test: tools/autotest.py -C out/Default components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping

> Test: tools/autotest.py -C out/Default components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping/NewWindowsInKioskAllowed.json

> Change-Id: I8eb36a69abd717bf69c56a7f1aa453209c3da5a2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5185801

> Reviewed-by: Maksim Ivanov

> Reviewed-by: Michael Thiessen

> Commit-Queue: Edman Anjos

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1254565}



Bug: b:319254568

entry.title: Log to Devtools browser-side failed trigger registrations
entry.content:
With the in-browser migration, triggers are now parsed in the browser.



With this change:

- When a parsing error is encountered in the browser, a Devtools issue

is logged and an event is emitted to the

Conversions.TriggerRegistrationError9 histogram.



- When a non suitable reporting origin is encountered, a Devtools issue

is logged.



This CL brings issue logging from the browser on par with issue logging

from blink. The `http/tests/inspector-protocol/attribution-reporting` WPT tests suite now runs with the in-browser migration enabled.

entry.title: [iOSKAUpgrade] Fix alert coordinator is being dismissed too soon
entry.content:
The FormInputAccessoryCoordinator's `reset` method does several things,

one of which is stopping all child coordinators. Triggering the `reset`

method when the keyboard accessory view disappears, caused an issue with

alerts. When an alert was presented (such as the one shown before

accessing the list of saved passwords), the keyboard accessory would

disappear, and `reset` would be called. The alert coordinator would then

be stopped, and the alert would automatically disappear from the screen.



This CL fixes the issue by performing every action that's done in

`reset`, except the one stopping the child coordinators when the

keyboard accessory disappears. Stopping the child view controllers at

this point is not necessary. Resetting the keyboard accessory and the

`formInputViewController` is really what's important here.



Bug: 1501851

Change-Id: I711dc87273012542724d80eec2fa8206e0c73ea8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5253742

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Don't check for maximum text length if using a local voice.
entry.content:
The maximum text length checks were built as a workaround for

crbug.com/1176078, but this bug only impacts remote voices.

Therefore, since these checks can slightly degrade Read Aloud

experience by splitting speech, don't use these checks if not

needed.



I've manually verified that adding this check for local voices

continues to split text as expected on Linux (to avoid the crash)

and does not split text on ChromeOS (where no crash is expected).



Bug: 1474951

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Move blocking dequeue to dedicated threads
entry.content:
VIDIOC_DQBUF calls are blocking. They wait for a buffer to be

done processing. |CreateSequencedTaskRunner| can share a thread.

When thread usage goes up, these blocking calls prevent other

task runners from working.

entry.title: [Android TRM] Add double-tile view.
entry.content:
This CL adds multi-tile view support to the Tab Resumption Module.

Noting that the number of shown suggestion tiles is capped at 2, so now

we'd have double-tile view or single-tile view (when there is only 1

valid suggestion). Details:

* Add tab_resumption_module_multi_tile_layout.xml: Layout of a small

tile for the multi-tile view. It has 2 TextView instead of 3 for the

single-tile case.

* Add tab_resumption_module_divider.xml: Layout of a divider.

* TabResumptionTileView: Add setSuggestionTextsMulti().

* TabResumptionTileContainerView:

* Update loadTileTexts() to take `isSingle` param, to selectively

render strings and call setSuggestionTexts{Single,Multi}().

* Update renderAllTiles() to visit all SuggestionEntry instances to

create TabResumptionTileView instances, also inserting a divider

between them.

* Update removeAllViews() to call destroy() only on

TabResumptionTileView instances, noting that tiles alternate with

dividers.



Tests:

* TabResumptionModuleMediatorUnitTest: Replace Activity usage with

ApplicationProvider, and update testTakeMostRecent() to account for

loading of a second image.

* TabResumptionModuleViewUnitTest: Add testRenderDouble() for the final

rendering stage where there are 2 tiles.

entry.title: IDB: prevent clients from evicting selves from BFCache
entry.content:
This change fixes most cases where a single client (render

frame) would cause itself to be disallowed from BFCache.

For example, if a single client creates two transactions A

and B, with A blocking B, this is no longer grounds for

disallowing BFCache.



To accomplish this, IndexedDB browser code becomes aware

of the identity of clients by way of an unguessable token

generated for each IndexedDBClientStateChecker. This token

is stored on the IndexedDBConnection as well as the

PartitionedLockHolder, so that methods like

`IsTransactionBlockingOthers()` can prevent same-client

IDB-scope-blocking relationships from ruling a client out of

BFCache.



This change also has the effect that a transaction that is

waiting on a lock will not be ruled out of BFCache. If this

client enters BFCache and then becomes unblocked, at that

point it may be evicted, but only if it is blocking other

clients.

entry.title: Rename CanonicalCookie::IsSecure to SecureAttribute
entry.content:
CanonicalCookie::IsSecure() is a simple getter that returns if a

cookie's "Secure" attribute was set or not.



I.e.: Set-Cookie: "foo=bar; Secure"



With the introduction of "source_scheme" a cookie could also be

considered secure if their setting scheme was secure. To try and help

reduce potential confusion this CL renames IsSecure() to

SecureAttribute() to hopefully indicate that this is a getter and not a

function which is trying to answer the question "was this cookie created

in a secure context?".



This CL is a simple renaming and does not change any logic.

entry.title: [iOS][Omnibox][Textfield] Fix text alignment in RTL
entry.content:
Fix text alignment in mix RTL/LTR.



The defaultTextAttributes from UITextField contains writing direction

and alignments attributes. These attributes are updated by UIKit when

the text is updated.

In pre edit state handling, modify the attributes from the existing

UIKit dictionary instead of creating a new one.



Also:

- Returns the textfield's semanticContentAttribute when text direction

is NSWritingDirectionNatural.

- Exit pre edit in will change to avoid overriding the text attributes

from the new text.

entry.title: [iOS][Bookmarks] When bookmarks are moved, tell where
entry.content:
This CL consider the user, using the bookmark editor. When the user

tap "Done", there is a bookmark that confirms an action occurred and

allows to undo it.



This CL changes the text of the bookmark in the case where the

bookmark’s folder changed.

In this case, the text shown is the same as if the user saved the

bookmark for the first time. That is, it shows the name of the new

folder. And if the user is syncing bookmark, it states whether

the bookmark will be local only or saved in the account.



In order to do this, some functions were moved from bookmark_mediator

to bookmark_utils_ios.

This moves the "decoration iteration" from TextPainterBase to

TextDecorationPainter. The low-level painting is still handled by the

TextPainter via a new PaintDecorationLine() function.

calling into TextPainterBase. Similarly in HighlightPainter use the

pre-bound TextDecorationPainter to paint decorations. This requires

svg/text/text-selection-deco-01-b.svg the underline decoration for the

word "different" is now painted as fill+stroke in order for each

decoration line (the inline element that contains this word has two)

rather than being painted as fill for each line followed by the stroke

for each line.

entry.title: Add UNSAFE_BUFFERS and UNSAFE_BUFFER_USAGE macros for C++ safe buffers
entry.content:
Functions annotated with UNSAFE_BUFFER_USAGE can not be called

from code that is opted into C++ safe buffers, unless the callsite is

wrapped with UNSAFE_BUFFERS(). All instances of UNSAFE_BUFFER_USAGE

should come with a Safety comment explaining the requirements of the

function that all callers must meet. All callers using the function

inside UNSAFE_BUFFERS() should explain in a SAFETY comment how they

meet the safety requirements of the unsafe function.



Pointer arithmetic/indexing can not be done in code that is opted into

C++ safe buffers either, unless the usage is wrapped with

UNSAFE_BUFFERS(). A SAFETY comment should be written explaining how the

preconditions of the unsafe pointer usage are met.



**USE OF UNSAFE_BUFFERS() SHOULD BE VERY RARE** and should come with

a "// SAFETY: " comment that explains how it is guaranteed to not cause

an out-of-bounds security bug that is based on local analysis only, such

as via CHECK()s. If the explanation requires cooperation of code that is

not fully encapsulated close to the `UNSAFE_BUFFERS()` usage, it should

be rejected and replaced with safer coding patterns or stronger

guarantees.



Using UNSAFE_BUFFERS() and getting it wrong gives a forever-path for

attackers to write exploits against Chrome. Avoid it almost always. Use

base::span instead of T*.



The UNSAFE_BUFFERS() macro can be used to narrowly scope a single

expression or can be used to wrap a whole block.



Wrapping an expression:



```

// Does spooky stuff.

//

// # Safety

// The pointer must be valid and point to an array of at least 5 `int`s.

UNSAFE_BUFFER_USAGE int spooky_function(int* pointer);



void f(span s) {

// SAFETY: The spooky_function requires the pointer has 5 ints,

// which is true because we have a span with at least 5 as

// specified in the type.

int x = UNSAFE_BUFFERS(spooky_function(s.data()));

...

}

```



Wrapping a block:



```

// Does spooky stuff.

//

// # Safety

// The pointer must be valid and point to an array of at least 5 `int`s.

UNSAFE_BUFFER_USAGE int* spooky_function(int* pointer);



void f(span s) {

UNSAFE_BUFFERS({

// SAFETY: The spooky_function requires the pointer has 5 ints,

// which is true because we have a span with at least 5 as

// specified in the type.

int* x = UNSAFE_BUFFERS(spooky_function(pointer));

hope_we_got_things_right(x[6u]);

})

}

```



Adds a `unsafe_buffer_warning_header_allowlist` list of paths that

will be considered system headers so that unsafe buffer usage in

those headers does not prevent us from enabling the warning on our

own code.



R=dcheng@chromium.org

entry.content:
This CL removes `RenderProcessHost::CreateURLLoaderFactory`

and replaces



`render_process_host->CreateURLLoaderFactory(...)`



and accompanying `WillCreateURLLoaderFactory()` calls with:



`url_loader_factory::Create*()` +

`url_loader_factory::TerminalParams::ForNetworkContext(

render_process_host->GetStoragePartition()->GetNetworkContext(),

...)`



This shouldn't change the behavior.



This CL adds two `kDevTools` and `kEarlyHints` to

`URLLoaderFactoryType`, in order to annotate related

`url_loader_factory::Create*()` calls.



This CL removes `ContextType` template parameter from

`URLLoaderFactoryBuilder` because after this CL `ContextType`

is always `network::mojom::NetworkContext`.

entry.title: Include Shadow DOM in unassociated listed elements.
entry.content:
This CL adds an experimental feature to include Shadow DOM elements

in unassociated listed elements.



Since Document::UnassociatedListedElements() is used solely by

WebDocument::UnassociatedFormControls(), which, in turn, is used

only by Autofill & PasswordManager, making this change should have

no unexpected side-effects for other callers. Both Autofill and

PasswordManager should include Shadow DOM elements in their unowned

form control elements.

entry.title: Minimize SkBitmap size when serialized
entry.content:
The serialization code for sending SkBitmaps as part of

CopyOutputResults used the same buffer size. With SkiaRenderer Ganesh

backends and SoftwareRenderer this buffer was already the minimum size.

When SkiaRenderer is using Graphite backend this is not the case and the

buffer can be larger.



Since serialization is already copying data there is no need to allocate

and copy extra bytes at the end of each row of pixel data.



This also helps to fix an Android UI resource problem where captured

pixels were being provided as a UIBitmapResource and uploaded to a

shared image. The CreateSharedImage() has no stride parameter so it's

assumed to be the minimum stride based on format and width. When the

captured pixel buffer had larger stride this caused shared image

creation to fail.



Bug: 1522189

Change-Id: I3cb519a5d29cbb1cf50013ef76f4217aa1aae44a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5238400

Reviewed-by: Joe Mason

entry.title: [Private Network Access] Remove ID restrictions
entry.content:
As discussed[1], restricting private-network-access-id to MAC

address-ish style won't improve security. It should be designed and

entry.title: Show `DefaultStoreChanged` bubble
entry.content:
This CL adds a functionality that checks if the default store value

matches the opt in the account store setting. If they are not aligned

the new `DefaultStoreChanged` will be shown.

The followup CLs will remove all old callers of the

`SetDefaultPasswordStore()` meaning that after they land, this bubble

will be shown no more than once.



Additionally buttons in the `DefaultStoreChanged` got their proper

implementations meaning that:

1) "Got it" button opens the Save bubble

2) "Settings" button opens the pwm settings page with a query

that will be used to trigger the iph and when the user goes back to

the tab that triggered this bubble the Save bubble will appear.

entry.title: [css-nesting] Handle invisible rules in StyleCascade/RuleSet
entry.content:
This CL adds invisible rules to the RuleSet, and gives them

special behavior in StyleCascade: whenever we see an invisible rule,

we set a flag, but otherwise proceed as normal (possibly triggering

signals caused by the invisible rules). Then, if we the flag is set,

we re-cascade without invisible rules to ensure that those rules aren't

observable.



See CL:5201402 for more information about what this is useful for.



Bug: 1517290

entry.title: Remove the main frame restration in race-network-and-fetch-handler
entry.content:
This CL removes the restriction in StartRaceNetworkRequest(), which

limits dispatching the request if the request is for the main frame.



This limitation is basically good for the auto-enabled feature e.g.

ServiceWorkerAutoPreload, but it's not suitable for the developer opt-in

features such as the race-network-and-fetch-handler option in the SW

static routing API.



This restriction also makes adding WPTs difficult, because service

worker WPTs basically ensure the main resource behavior by using

iframes, which is not a main frame.



This CL moves the main frame check from StartRaceNetworkRequest() to

MaybeStartAutoPreload(). Also updated to check

|resource_request_.is_outermost_main_frame|, which is more

straightforward.



Bug: 1371756, 1519727

Change-Id: I9b0658e9bcb6ac8a31cf566605b23e38defdea2a

entry.title: ContentPasswordManagerDriver: Avoid speculative RenderFrameHost issues.
entry.content:
A request to bind the PasswordAutofillAgent() might happen against

speculative RenderFrameHost. Those are RenderFrameHost that haven't

committed their document.



In this state, it is too early to know if the RenderFrameHost is a

credentialless or not. The call to RenderFrameHost::IsCredentialless()

fails.



I suspect this is caused when trying to call SetLoggingState() during

the ContentPasswordManagerDriver constructor.



This patch:

- Stop checking for IsCredentialless before calling SetLoggingState(..)

- Apply several refactor to this class.

an unclassified fields. Granular filling adds flows where the Autofill

popup is re-opened after some dialog is closed. The popup still needs

to be re-opened is these cases. We can pass manual fallback trigger

source to do so because manual fallbacks can't trigger suggestion types

such as autocomplete, compose, etc.

entry.title: Rework text-shadow painting for text decorations
entry.content:
The current painting code-path for text-decorations with text-shadows is

complicated: line-throughs are painted using a draw-looper while the

rest of the decorations are painted for each shadow "layer" using a

DropShadowPaintFilter.



Unify these two by introducing a ScopedTextShadowPainter object that

constructs a filter - either a single DropShadowPaintFilter or a merge

filter combining one DropShadowPaintFilter for each layer. This makes

the two cases consistent, and for non-line-through decorations there's

no longer a need to run the paint code for each shadow "layer".

entry.title: Make "key" argument in std::erase_if predicate const.
entry.content:
You're generally not supposed to modify the key in the map while

iterating, or removing elements from the map. The standard seem to

assume the key passed to predicate is const, but most implementations

do not seem to care. In libstdc++ case however this changes with

version 31 from GCC 12. Without const qualifier the code fails to

compile.



Bug: 957519

entry.title: Remove values impossible to record from Autofill.WebView.AutofillSession
entry.content:
AutofillProvideUMA's SessionRecorder does not record any events until

the EVENT_VIRTUAL_STRUCTURE_PROVIDED event is recorded.

This is not new logic, it has existed since the file was created.



All the values deleted in this CL required at least two events to be

recorded, one of them being EVENT_VIRTUAL_STRUCTURE_PROVIDED. This is

impossible.



Additional proof these values have never been recorded:

http://uma/p/chrome/timeline_v2?sid=f49685c00118d8d0a2f80e8e5aed2f62

http://uma/p/chrome/timeline_v2?sid=cfd4f6ad027502d8257606eb8d856c38

entry.title: [ios] Remove special treatment for IsRestoreSessionInProgress()
entry.content:
Since https://crrev.com/c/4989444 WebStateImpl supports calling

SerializeToProto(...) at any point for realized WebState. Since

it is possible for IsRestoreSessionInProgress() to return true

even if the WebStateImpl has never been in the unrealized state

(e.g. it returns true during the first load), the code that was

special casing IsRestoreSessionInProgress() was incorrect.



Fixes a DCHECK failure in SessionRestorationServiceImpl if the

session save happens just after a WebStateImpl transition in

that state.



Bug: 1383087

Change-Id: I90aeadecfe0ded41b2865eea82e49a392334c62b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5249797
